data.title: Drew Miller, MD, FAAFP
data.meta_description: Dr. Drew Miller is certified in family medicine. He practices full scope family medicine, including providing obstetrical services. He also has extensive experience in procedures such as endoscopy, vasectomy, joint injections, and dermatologic procedures.
data.text:
Dr. Drew Miller is certified in family medicine. He practices full scope family medicine, including providing obstetrical services. He also has extensive experience in procedures such as endoscopy, vasectomy, joint injections, and dermatologic procedures. Dr. Miller is passionate about practicing full scope family medicine in a rural setting. Dr. Miller graduated from University of Kansas School of Medicine in 2007, and completed his residency at Via Christi Family Medicine Residency in Wichita, KS, in 2010. He has been at Kearny County Hospital since 2010. Dr. Miller is active in the community of Lakin, including coaching local kids sports teams and being active in church. Dr. Miller is married and has 4 children. In his spare time, he enjoys spending time with his family, as well as playing the piano.

Qualifications

Selected as KAFP Family Physician of the Year (2021)

Certified in Family Medicine by American Board of Family Medicine

Member of American Academy of Family Physicians / Kansas Academy of Family Physicians

Member of National Registry of Certified Medical Examiners to perform DOT exams

Current AAFP Media Ambassador

Nominated for KAFP Family Physician of the Year (2016)

Member of KAFP board of directors 2015-2019

Specialties

Family Medicine
